results.title: Giorgio Armani: Calvin Klein
results.creator_credit: Marlene McGinnis Cardin, Rebecca Reeder and Videofashion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Designers”.
A fascinating documentary focusing on two of fashions most sought-after designers. Giorgio Armani is regarded as one of fashion’s master tailors, and was also one of the first designers to actively seek patronage from Hollywood, coming to prominence after Richard Gere wore an Armani blazer in the film American Gigolo. As a result, the name Armani is synonymous with wealth, elegance and prestige. Calvin Klein, on the other hand, is more famous as a brand name and an image. Klein became a household name after launching a brand of designer jeans, with a controversial advertising campaign featuring a young Brooke Shields. His simple yet appealing designs and lack of interest in adopting seasonal trends have helped him to build a successful billion dollar business.

results.title: Gina Jeffreys: somebody's daughter the story so far
results.brief_description: This video offers an insight into the background, aspirations, influences, thoughts and dreams of country singer Gina Jeffreys. Born and raised in Toowoomba, Gina moved away from her family to settle in Sydney and further her musical career which began when she won the Star Maker award in 1991 (although she does have fond memories of busking at the local Mexican restaurant). Since then Gina has been awarded the Golden Guitar at Tamworth for Best Female Vocalist three years in a row. Gina relates memories of her rise to fame and footage is provided from the launch of her latest album, “Somebody’s daughter”. Full music clips are provided of “Dancin’ with Elvis”, “Josephine” and “I haven’t got a heart”.

results.title: Gilly, the salamander
results.creator_credit: Mimi Lampert and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Because only his egg escaped a catfish massacre, Gilly grows up thinking he is really a too-long frog. Finally, unable to bear the unkind jibes of the frogs, he leaves the pond to find his true identity. When he returns he meets Sally Salamander, who tells him the facts of his life. This film uses the story about a salamander to motivate the practice of language skills and to encourage young children to share experiences in learning about themselves. For primary grades.

results.title: Gillian's Story
results.brief_description: Leanne Wagner pays tribute to her remarkable sister Gillian who has had to battle with Sturge-Weber syndrome, epilepsy, schizophrenia, glaucoma and an intellectial disability.

results.title: Gill Armstrong
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Film Makers”.
Michael Carlton interviews Australian film-maker Gillian Armstrong about her motivations for making films, and discusses some of her productions, in particular “My brilliant career”.

results.title: Gilbert and George [Widescreen] (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TheEYE”.
Part of a series of interview-based profiles of contemporary visual artists in Britain. Gilbert Prousch met George Passmore at St Martin’s School of Art in 1967. Since then they have famously lived and worked together as Gilbert & George, creating an extraordinary body of provocative artworks. They have exhibited themselves as “Living Sculptures”, documented the banality of their daily lives in London’s East End, and, since the late 1970s, produced vibrant, challenging photographic collages. This profile of Gilbert & George features a characteristically deadpan performance of themselves. Sex, money, race and religion, they explain, are four themes at the heart of their art. Their interview is complemented by images of many of their works, including the remarkable Dirty Words Pictures made in 1977, together with important collages of the 1980s and 1990s. Please note: this video contains explicit images and adult language featured in artworks by Gilbert & George.

results.title: Gifts from the earth
results.creator_credit: Theodore Thomas, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Planet earth”.
There are only 150 sites world wide for the minerals essential to man and in the past decade we have been made aware that the earth is a closed system and its resources are finite. This program looks at the challenge of finding new sources of these minerals and the highly sophisticated technologies which are employed to do so, and also at how the resources are created.
